3 of 3 #scotsfoundedfootball THE VALE3 So what? How could a tiny area of Scotland have the three greatest teams in the world in the 1880s? Professionalism in England was the death of small town teams, but Dumbarton’s Scotch professors left their mark on world football.

2 of 3 #scotsfoundedfootball THE VALE3 The big game of 1881 was the Cup Final Replay at Kinning Park (Rangers’ Ground). The first game was a bad tempered affair, noted for kicking and charging. The replay was conspicuous in its ‘combination, passing and dribbling on both sides’.

1 of 3 #scotsfoundedfootball THE VALE3 Dumbarton also founded ’72 were a match for VofL and Renton. Scot Cup winners in 1883, (2-1 Vale Of L). In that brief period between League foundation and professionalism they were twice champions. The 84 Scotland team had 3 Dumbarton men.
